please carry this change to dev4.x branch also

Welcome @SteNicholas 
Currently, @jingshanglu is doing the first one. When it completes, two of you can process the following item parallelly. AFAIK, there is a bit of work for the first one. So let us leave him one or two days to finish.
@jingshanglu Hi could you take charge of this one?

If db0 and db1 in the same mysql instance, you can query
`select u.*, c.name as class_name from db0.user u,  db1.class c 
    where u.username="test" and  u.class_id=c.id  `

Otherwise, mysql can't support.
thx.  sloved it.

@jacknate, sorry, shardingsphere can't get the auto generate key from mysql. For distributed system, distributed primary key should generate by key generator.
No more response in 7 days, I will close this issue.

Other type I find is similar to JSON type -- BIT. In mysql, BIT type can follow a length like `bit(n)` to set the storage way. And it will be different in binlog. But I do not find any description in mysql  and MariaDB document.

Currently, scaling will throw a log to warn users BIT type is unsupported.

What about using `Dumper` to replace `Reader`? 
In mysql, exporting inventory data can using `mysqldump`, subscribe binlog use `COM_BINLOG_DUMP` command. 

Also in PostgreSQL, exporting inventory data can using `pg_dump`

So I think `Dumper` may be better.

About `Writer`, I think we can use `Importer` to replace.

In mysql we use `mysqlimport` to import data from dump file.
And in `Datagrip` which database tool by JetBrains, the behavior also is `import`.
